title: MedStar Georgetown University Hospital
description: We are the second largest hospital in Washington, D.C., located at 3800 Reservoir Rd NW, and are committed to offering innovative diagnostic treatment options including proton therapy technology for cancer.
cleaned_text: Creating an environment of personalized care MedStar Georgetown University Hospital is committed to creating an environment of personalized care focused on the unique needs of our patients. Our physicians—many of them fellowship-trained—are nationally and internationally renowned for their expertise, as well as for their innovative approaches from diagnosis to treatments. We are dedicated to ensuring continuity of care through our expert specialty and multidisciplinary teams from initial consults to second opinions and complex surgeries. MedStar Georgetown was the first hospital in Washington, D.C., to receive Magnet® recognition for demonstrating excellence in nursing care. Since then, we have been re-designated three times given our outstanding commitment and dedication to our patients from our world-class nursing staff. To further enhance the care we provide, MedStar Georgetown is constructing a [Medical/Surgical Pavilion](/building-medical-excellence) that will feature a new Emergency Department, new operating rooms, all-private patient rooms, three levels of underground parking, and new, attractive green space for the comfort of patients and visitors. Founded in the Jesuit principle of cura personalis, caring for the whole person, MedStar Georgetown is dedicated to focusing on the full needs of our patients and their families that go beyond their immediate healthcare needs and providing the comfort they need to help them heal. This philosophy empowers our associates to work together to provide holistic care, as well as a trusting and compassionate environment. Centers of excellence and healthcare services - [Transplant](/services/medstar-georgetown-transplant-institute)(MedStar Georgetown Transplant Institute) - [Cancer services](/services/cancer)(MedStar Georgetown Cancer Institute) - - - Awards and recognition - U.S. News and World Report - National Cancer Institute (NCI)-designated Comprehensive Cancer Center - Magnet® Recognition for Excellence in Nursing - National Accreditation from the Commission on Cancer (CoC) of the American College of Surgeons - Parkinson's Foundation Center of Excellence - Nationally Recognized in Maternity Care - MedStar Georgetown Awarded FACT Accreditation - Huntington's Disease Center of Excellence - The Joint Commission's Gold Seal of Approval® and the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association's Heart-Check Mark for Advanced Certification for Comprehensive Stroke Centers - Apex Recognition for Commitment to Excellence in Respiratory Care by American Association for Respiratory Care - First Patient Blood Management Certification - Prism Award - Beacon Award - National Accreditation for Breast Center - National Pancreas Foundation Center of Excellence - Breast Imaging Center of Excellence - American College of Radiology Accredited Facility Visiting our hospital Located right next to Georgetown University, our hospital is easily accessible by public transportation or by car. Patient and visitor information With a 609-licensed bed hospital, 1,100 physicians, and primary care providers at numerous sites in Washington, D.C., Maryland, and Virginia, MedStar Georgetown's clinical services represent one of the largest, most geographically diverse and fully integrated healthcare delivery networks in the area. Inpatient experience Our commitment to our mission of providing physical and spiritual comfort to our patients and their families makes MedStar Georgetown a very special place to receive care. Insurance MedStar Health participates with most major health insurance plans. Please contact your insurance company to make sure your plan is covered. Our Services Meet our leaders The leaders of MedStar Georgetown are fully committed to supporting our mission of expert and compassionate patient care.
